metadata.title: Feline Leukemia Virus and Other Pathogens as Important Threats to the Survival of the Critically Endangered Iberian Lynx (Lynx pardinus)

abstract.original_text: Background: The Iberian lynx (Lynx pardinus) is considered the most endangered felid species in the world. In order to save this species, the Spanish authorities implemented a captive breeding program recruiting lynxes from the wild. In this context, a retrospective survey on prevalence of selected feline pathogens in free-ranging lynxes was initiated.

sentences.segment_text: Background : The Iberian lynx ( Lynx pardinus ) is considered the most endangered felid species in the world .
In order to save this species ,
the Spanish authorities implemented a captive breeding program recruiting lynxes from the wild .
In this context , a retrospective survey on prevalence of selected feline pathogens in free-ranging lynxes was initiated .
